reviewText: Saw this years ago and loved it, can't wait for a chance to sit down and watch it again. Really loved most of the seasons, only down side I can think of to owning the whole set would be that the later seasons got more and more soap opera like and less and less believable, almost painfully so. Still the first half is so much fun it is worth the ride for any country girl stuck in the city, or any city girl who has ever daydreamed about country life.

reviewText: I can't remember when I've enjoyed a show so much. I watch the first 3 seasons over and over. It's compelling, deals with real, down to earth issues and it has a sense of humor. The characters are so well drawn, the dramatic structure of the scripts is just plain engaging, engrossing and addictive. It's the sort of show that every time you watch it you hear or see something you missed the first dozen times you've viewed it.

reviewText: Koch Vision present "MCLEOD'S DAUGHTERS: THE COMPLETE FIRST SEASON" (Released: 2004) (960 mins/Color) (Dolby Digital) --- McLeod's Daughters is an Australian television drama set in the rural outback --- This release presents all 22 episodes from the first season of MCLEOD'S DAUGHTERS. Claire (Lisa Chappell) and Tess (Bridie Carter) are the two daughters of the title, and at the beginning of the show they are reunited after a long separation --- The reunion is brought about by their joint inheritance of Drover's Run, a cattle farm that has been in their family for many generations --- Together, the two gather an all-female group of workers to keep the place going. The show creates some admirably strong, inspirational female characters, and builds its original premise into well-crafted story lines.FEATURES ALL 22 FIRST SEASON EPISODES:1. (Widescreen Format)McLeod's Daughters: Welcome HomeMcLeod's Daughters: Ducks on the PondMcLeod's Daughters: Don't Mess With the GirlsMcLeod's Daughters: Who's the Boss?McLeod's Daughters: Taking the ReinsMcLeod's Daughters: Reality BitesMcLeod's Daughters: Pride and JoyMcLeod's Daughters: Stir CrazyMcLeod's Daughters: Into the WoodsMcLeod's Daughters: HauntedMcLeod's Daughters: Who's a Big Girl Now?McLeod's Daughters: Pandora's BoxMcLeod's Daughters: True Love and ConsequencesMcLeod's Daughters: Dirty PoolMcLeod's Daughters: If the Boot FitsMcLeod's Daughters: Playing to WinMcLeod's Daughters: Girls' Night OutMcLeod's Daughters: More Than One WayMcLeod's Daughters: The Italian StallionMcLeod's Daughters: Lover Come BackMcLeod's Daughters: Friends Like TheseMcLeod's Daughters: Deep Water2. Original "McLeod's Daughters" tv movie starring Jack Thompson;3. "Inside Story" behind-the-scenes making-of featurette;4. Interviews with producer/creator Posie Graeme-Evans, co-producer Andrew Blaxland and director Karl ZwickyMcLeod's Daughter's is an original Australian TV show, with high quality writing, acting and scenery --- completely character driven, exceptional stories about people --- script is very unique in content a big spread run by 5 women --- our series is about two half sisters, separated as children who reunite as adults to jointly work the family ranch after the parents have all died --- The country girl Claire who grew up on "Drovers Run" is trying to make a go of it --- the city girl Tess arrives on the scene expecting to collect her inheritance in cash --- Tess now learns the realities of cash strapped ranching, as she reconnects with both her sister and the land where she was a young child --- We are introduced to the other residents of Drovers Run, through Tess' eyes --- Witness her warm and outgoing personality wins over the viewer as easily as anyone on the show --- Thrown together after 20 years apart they pull together an all female workforce --- with an abundance of heart and humor, commit to an extraordinary life at Drovers Run,Great job by Koch Vision --- looking forward to more high quality titles from the BBC Collection film market --- order your copy now from Amazon or Koch Vision where there are plenty of copies available on DVD, stay tuned once again for top notch releases --- where they are experts in releasing long forgotten films and treasures to the collector.Total Time: 960 mins on DVD ~ Koch Vision ~ (10/03/2006)
summary: "McLeod's Daughters (2004) ... Complete First Season ... Koch Vision (2006)"

reviewText: I love this series.  It is heartfelt.  Nothing on American TV is this catching. Its about two sister who were seperated young and reunite with each other after their father dies. The two sisters are very different and the series follows their growing love for each other and the land that ties them together.  Of course there are more characters and some good looking Men.  This series makes me long to vist Australia.  The landscape is beautiful and the actors do a great job making the characters seem like you know them and feel their emotions.  Love it!  Only wish a station would pick up the series agian.  I will buy the next season as soon as it comes out.

reviewText: I subscribed to Netflix so I could choose some quality shows to watch instead of the trash that is on TV now.  McLeod's Daughters is a gem.  It doesn't avoid conflict, instead, the characters work their way through their problems.So far, I'm only in Season 1, and plan to watch the complete series.  This kind of TV show needs to come back; our world is chaotic and stressful. This kind of entertainment is a reminder of how we should treat our family, and friends.  I have recommended this show to several friends.  Try it !
summary: A great show about family, friends, caring...

reviewText: This DVD is the entire 1st season of the hit Australian TV show which is now available in the USA. It is the story of 2 sisters who inherit the ranch Drover's Run in South Australia. Clare and Tess McLeod, played by Lisa Chappell and Bridie Carter, run a sheep and cattle ranch along with 3 other women. My wife introduced me to this series and I have totally enjoyed it. It is certainly not just for females. The acting is excellent and the scenes are very realistic. There are male characters, primarily the Ryans who own another ranch and react with the McLeod ladies. This is an excellent show which is better than anything on US TV and it is highly recommended.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Quick overview: Set in the great Australian Outback, two sisters are brought together after the death of the McLeod patriarch . It begins with a reluctant agreement between the girls to find a solution to settle his estate to both their liking. As they get to know each other again a bond forms leaving the possibility for more. Maybe a friendship?One of my all time favorite television series. There are TONS of laughs and a fair dose of mischief. Watching the women learn one another is funny, but the near-constant chaos on the farm is hilarious. Being an "introduction" to the saga, most of the episodes are pretty light.The cast has such a great chemistry that I could only compare to the group of actors on "Friends." While there are quite a few support roles, each is valuable and contributes to the richness of the story.
summary: enriching and comedic drama set in Australia, actors with great chemistry
Title: N/A

reviewText: McLeod's Daughters is one of Australia's best-loved shows and is either in its 7th or 8th season there, but its first few seasons are generally considered its best.  Bouncy and sweet-natured city girl Tess arrives at her late father Jack McLeod's country estate of Drover's Run expecting a warm welcome from her half sister Claire and a sizable enough inheritance to go back to the city and start her dream of owning a cafe.  But the only welcome she gets is the cold realization that Drover's Run is far from rolling in it, and an even colder response from fierce, smart Claire because their father willed half his property to Tess, who hasn't set her foot on the farm in years.  Will Claire and Tess (with a little help from Meg, their housekeeper/mother figure, her spoiled daughter Jodi, and Becky, the local girl with a trashy reputation) put aside their differences so they can come together and save their father's legacy?I'm sure you can predict the answer is yes, but it's the way this show goes about portraying it.  The first few seasons of McLeod's Daughters have everything it needs to be completely engrossing - emotional but funny, warm but witty.  What struck me most about this show is how REAL it seems - you become so involved in these characters and their lives that you think you've got a window on actual people and not actors speaking lines.  The sets help; the property that is "Drover's Run" was an actual property in the Australian outback that the creators bought to film the show.  But so does the writing and the acting - aside from the 5-women main cast, standouts include Marshall Napier as Harry Ryan, the somewhat nice but usually nasty neighbor of the McLeod women who has his eyes set on acquiring Drover's, and his gorgeous sons, Alex and Nick.  And yes, if you guessed that the men provide plenty of love interest material, you'd be right, but they provide lots of other things like humor, too.  My favorite is Jessica Napier as Becky, the classic underdog character of the story, but the show always makes Becky out to be strong and independent, never whiny or weak.The one thing I didn't care for in this first season was a story arc concerning Becky that goes longer than I thought necessary and pushes the show into somewhat soap-ish territory.  MD is considered a soap, not a drama, but in its first few seasons I really do think its storylines are more dramatic than soapy.Bottom line being, buy this show.  As someone who loves adventure and fantasy shows and hates dramas, I LOVE this show.  It's just very well-made television, period.
summary: very likely the best drama show I have ever watched
